content.body: annevk: Right now mimesniff says stuff like "User agents may implicitly extend this table to support additional MIME types." which seems bad for interop. And I'm writing some of the tests to say "I explicitly expect you to download this resource". So, in that context, it seems to me like a minimum list of supported MIME types (and maybe explicitly unsupported MIME types?) would be beneficial.
